sen.j: 黄表紙（きびょうし）は江戸時代中期の1775年以降に流行した草双紙（一種の絵本）のジャンルの一つ。
sen.e: Kibyoshi is one of the genres of kusazoshi (illustrated story books) which was popular after 1775, the mid-Edo period.

sen.j: 恋川春町の『金々先生栄花夢』（1775年刊行）がそれまでの幼稚な草双紙とは一線を画する、大人向けの読み物として評判になった。
sen.e: "Kinkin sensei eigano yume" (Master Flashgold's Splendiferous Dream) written by Harumachi KOIKAWA got famous as a reading for adults, which was distinguished from the childish kusazoshi that had been written until then.

sen.e: Among the kibyoshi written by Kisanji HOSEIDO and Harumachi KOIKAWA, the ones whose titles contained the words 'literary and military arts' were put under pressure by bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) as they were satires against Sadanobu MATSUDAIRA's encouraging policy of literary and military arts.
